{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3333830,"name":"chrisrin","username":"chrisrin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chrisrin/{size}/160418_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-15T16:26:33.777Z","cooked":"

I searched & did not find a dedicated discussion about this.

The polycarb-protected April tags are harder for vision systems to see reliably due to reflections/glare. What are you doing about it?

We tried polarizing sheet yesterday, but it didn’t help. We’re going to try a polarizing camera lens filter, but I’m not sure it’ll do much better.

Tricks? Tips? Thanks!
